DataElement.preferredName: Oligonucleotide Primer Pair Laboratory Procedure Performed Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent the name of the method of oligonucleotide primer pair testing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Oligonucleotide Primer Pair Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Short DNA oligonucleotide chains used to prime DNA (and in some cases RNA) synthesis._A set of two similar things considered as a unit._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Performed; carried out.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Short DNA oligonucleotide chains used to prime DNA (and in some cases RNA) synthesis.:A set of two similar things considered as a unit.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: Short DNA oligonucleotide chains used to prime DNA (and in some cases RNA) synthesis.
A set of two similar things considered as a unit.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichtenberg 10/2010 sw

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Short DNA oligonucleotide chains used to prime DNA (and in some cases RNA) synthesis._A set of two similar things considered as a unit._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A PCR technique that uses the GP5+/GP6+ primer set for HPV detection. It amplifies a 150 bp region from the L1 region of the HPV genome.

Concepts.definition: A PCR technique that uses the GP5+/GP6+ primer set for HPV detection. It amplifies a 150 bp region from the L1 region of the HPV genome.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA on 02/23/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A PCR technique that uses the SPF10 primer set for HPV detection. It amplifies a 65 bp region from the L1 region of the HPV genome. Genotype identification is achieved by using a reverse line probe assay (LiPA).

Concepts.definition: A PCR technique that uses the SPF10 primer set for HPV detection. It amplifies a 65 bp region from the L1 region of the HPV genome. Genotype identification is achieved by using a reverse line probe assay (LiPA).

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/23/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A PCR technique that uses a pool of 5 upstream and 13 downstream primers, which are based on the binding sites for the MY09/MY11 degenerate primer set, for HPV detection. It amplifies a 450 bp region from the L1 region of the HPV genome.

Concepts.definition: A PCR technique that uses a pool of 5 upstream and 13 downstream primers, which are based on the binding sites for the MY09/MY11 degenerate primer set, for HPV detection. It amplifies a 450 bp region from the L1 region of the HPV genome.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/23/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A PCR technique that uses the MY09/MY11 degenerate primer set for HPV detection. It amplifies a 450 bp region from the L1 region of the HPV genome.

Concepts.definition: A PCR technique that uses the MY09/MY11 degenerate primer set for HPV detection. It amplifies a 450 bp region from the L1 region of the HPV genome.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/23/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary PCR technique that uses a pool of primers to amplify a 450 bp region in the L1 region of the HPV genome. It is capable of detecting 37 high- and low-risk human papillomavirus genotypes.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary PCR technique that uses a pool of primers to amplify a 450 bp region in the L1 region of the HPV genome. It is capable of detecting 37 high- and low-risk human papillomavirus genotypes.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/23/2015.
